results.title: Ada's story
results.creator_credit: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ada Peterson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.
description_for_label: Ada Peterson’s brother received a call twelve years ago from a person they didn’t know. It was their sister, Rhonda, who was taken as a child, a member of what is now known as the stolen generation. After getting over the initial shock and apprehension, getting to know Rhonda and her story has taken Ada’s life in a different direction, bringing her closer to celebrating who she is.

results.title: Like mother...like daughter
results.creator_credit: Christine Lamb, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Christine Lamb is constantly told how much she’s like her mother. It is through looking back on her life and all the things her mother taught her, that Lamb learns how similar they really are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christine Lamb, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Princes Street Port Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My family
results.brief_description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.
results.description: Salma gives a first-hand account of being a refugee. Fleeing the conflict in Sudan, she talks about the pain and anxiety of her journey to Australia, as well as the gratitude she feels for her new country.

results.title: Art 4 Starts
results.creator_credit: Sonya Waters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sonya Waters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
description_for_label: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.

results.title: Australyaya Gelisiminhikayesi = Coming to Australia
results.creator_credit: Riza Guclu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Riza Guclu moved to Australia with his family, he was looking for a better life, like most immigrants. With that in mind, he learnt what he need to help him succeed.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Riza Guclu, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
